# scm_content_id_setting (Resource)

ContentIdSetting resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "scm_content_id_setting" "cid_example" {
  folder = "All"
  content_id = {
    allow_forward_decrypted_content = true
    extended_capture_segment        = 6
    tcp_bypass_exceed_queue         = true
    udp_bypass_exceed_queue         = true
    allow_http_range                = true
    x_forwarded_for                 = "0"
    strip_x_fwd_for                 = false
    application = {
      bypass_exceed_queue = false
    }
  }

}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `content_id` (Attributes) Content id (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--content_id))
- `device` (String) The device in which the resource is defined
> ℹ️ **Note:** You must specify exactly one of `device`, `folder`, and `snippet`.
- `folder` (String) The folder in which the resource is defined
> ℹ️ **Note:** You must specify exactly one of `device`, `folder`, and `snippet`.
- `snippet` (String) The snippet in which the resource is defined
> ℹ️ **Note:** You must specify exactly one of `device`, `folder`, and `snippet`.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) UUID of the resource
- `tfid` (String) The Terraform ID.

<a id="nestedatt--content_id"></a>
### Nested Schema for `content_id`

Optional:

- `allow_forward_decrypted_content` (Boolean) Allow forward decrypted content
- `allow_http_range` (Boolean) Allow http range
- `application` (Attributes) Application (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--content_id--application))
- `extended_capture_segment` (Number) Extended capture segment
- `strip_x_fwd_for` (Boolean) Strip x fwd for
- `tcp_bypass_exceed_queue` (Boolean) Tcp bypass exceed queue
- `udp_bypass_exceed_queue` (Boolean) Udp bypass exceed queue
- `x_forwarded_for` (String) X forwarded for

<a id="nestedatt--content_id--application"></a>
### Nested Schema for `content_id.application`

Optional:

- `bypass_exceed_queue` (Boolean) Bypass exceed queue


## Import

The following command can be used to import a resource not managed by Terraform:

```bash
terraform import scm_content_id_setting.example folder:::id
```

or

```bash
terraform import scm_content_id_setting.example :snippet::id
```

or

```bash
terraform import scm_content_id_setting.example ::device:id
```

**Note:** Please provide just one of folder, snippet, or device for the import command.
